name: Garlic Shrimp Aguachile
ingredients: {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cilantro leaves'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'chile pepper, sliced, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'raw shrimp - peeled, meticulously deveined, and sliced in half horizontally if large'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cucumber'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'jalapeno, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': '2 tablespoons cilantro leaves, or as needed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'tortilla chips, for serving'}

name: Mexican Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'lemons, juiced, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'white onions, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomato, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, peeled and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'radishes, finely diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'fresh garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': None, 'name': 'fresh jalapeño peppers, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomato and clam juice cocktail'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tortilla chips'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Place shrimp in a bowl. You may either coarsely chop the shrimp, or leave them whole, depending on your preference. Add lemon juice, covering shrimp completely. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes, or until opaque and slightly firm.. Add onions, tomato, cucumber, radishes, and garlic; toss to combine. Gradually add jalapeño and cilantro to desired taste (jalapeño will grow stronger while marinating).. Stir in tomato and clam juice cocktail to desired consistency.. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve chilled with tortilla chips.

name: Crab Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'imitation crabmeat, flaked'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'serrano peppers, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'cilantro, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}
steps: Place imitation crab into a large glass or porcelain bowl; stir in olive oil until well coated. Stir in tomatoes, serrano peppers, onion, and cilantro. Squeeze lime juice on top and mix well. Season generously with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for about 1 hour before serving.

name: Mango Shrimp Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'shrimp'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'cucumber'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pint', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'jalapeno pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'fresh mango'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'lime, juiced,'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Tajin®)'}
steps: Combine shrimp, cucumber, tomatoes, jalapeno, mango, lime juice, cilantro, and Tajin seasoning in a large bowl. Taste; add more Tajin if needed.. For more flavor, cover and refrigerate for 1 hour (optional).

name: Best Ever Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'jalapenos, minced'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup finely', 'name': 'tomato'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cucumber'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'mango, finely diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'sea bass, cut into 1/2-inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '3/4', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'avocado, cut into 1/2-inch cubes'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'fresh tortilla chips for serving'}

name: Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'bay scallops'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'celery, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, minced'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, minced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Rinse scallops and place in a medium bowl. Pour lime juice over scallops; scallops should be completely immersed in lime juice. Cover and chill in the refrigerator until scallops are opaque, 8 hours to overnight.. Discard 1/2 of the lime juice from the bowl. Add celery, tomatoes, bell pepper, green onions, parsley, cilantro, olive oil, and black pepper; stir gently until combined.

name: Ceviche Peruano
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'potatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'sweet potatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red onion, cut into thin strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'stalk', 'name': 'celery, sliced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lightly packed cilantro leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'habanero pepper, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'fresh tilapia, cut into 1/2-inch pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'medium shrimp - peeled, deveined, and cut into 1/2-inch pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'bibb or Boston lettuce, separated into leaves'}
steps: Place the potatoes and sweet potatoes in a saucepan and cover with water. Simmer until the potatoes are easily pierced with a fork, then drain, and set aside to cool to room temperature. Place the sliced onion in a bowl of warm water, let stand 10 minutes, then drain and set aside.. Meanwhile, place the lime juice, celery, cilantro, and cumin into the bowl of a blender, and puree until smooth. Pour this mixture into a large glass bowl, and stir in the garlic and habanero pepper. Season with salt and pepper, then stir in the diced tilapia and shrimp.. Set aside to marinate for an hour, stirring occasionally. The seafood is done once it turns firm and opaque.. To serve, peel the potatoes and cut into slices. Stir the onions into the fish mixture. Line serving bowls with lettuce leaves. Spoon the ceviche with its juice into the bowls and garnish with slices of potato.

name: Mahi Mahi Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'mahi mahi fillets, diced, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced jalapeno pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced avocados'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'peeled and seeded diced cucumber'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced orange segments'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'radishes, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}
steps: Stir mahi mahi, lime juice, lemon juice, jalapeno pepper, salt, oregano, and cayenne pepper together in a bowl. Press down fish to completely immerse in liquid. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and press plastic wrap down so that it is touching the fish. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or up to 6 hours.. Stir avocado, cucumber, orange, chives, radish, cilantro, and olive oil into mahi mahi mixture until completely coated. Season with salt.

name: Avocado Shrimp Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'large shrimp - peeled, deveined and chopped'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'white onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'hot pepper sauce'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocado - peeled, pitted and diced'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': '', 'name': 'saltine crackers'}
steps: Place the shrimp and lime juice into a large bowl, and stir to coat. Let stand for about 5 minutes, or until shrimp are opaque. The lime juice will cure them. Mix in the tomatoes, onion, and cilantro until coated with lime juice; cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.. Remove from the refrigerator, and mix in the Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, hot sauce, salt and pepper. We have our own hot sauce recipe, but you can use whatever hot sauce you like, or leave it out and let people add their own when serving.. Serve in glass tumblers and top with avocado pieces. Set out extra Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, lime wedges and hot sauce for people to individualize their dish. Serve with saltine crackers.

name: Salmon Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sea salt, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chili paste or sauce'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'fresh ground pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cumin'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'minced red onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'ripe tomato, finely diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'very fresh salmon fillets (sushi-grade preferred), thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocado, sliced'}
steps: Dissolve sugar, salt, and chili paste in lime juice in a large glass or plastic bowl. Season with pepper and cumin. Stir in olive oil, garlic, onion, tomato, and cilantro. Gently mix in salmon; cover and refrigerate for 4 hours.. To serve, drain the excess liquid from the salmon, then gently stir in avocado slices. Allow to rest at room temperature for 15 minutes.

name: Jose's Shrimp Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'peeled and deveined medium shrimp'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': None, 'name': 'plum tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'yellow onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'jalapeño pepper, seeded and minced, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'avocados, diced (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'ribs celery, diced (Optional)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro to taste'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}
steps: Place shrimp in a large glass or other non-reactive bowl, and cover with lime juice to marinate (or 'cook') until they turn pink and opaque, about 10 minutes.. Meanwhile, place plum tomatoes, onion, jalapeño, avocados, and celery in separate large glass or other non-reactive bowl.. Remove shrimp from lime juice, reserving juice. Dice shrimp and add to bowl of vegetables. Add reserved lime juice marinade, cilantro, and salt and pepper to taste. Toss gently to combine.

name: Easy Shrimp Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Roma tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'serrano peppers, seeded and deveined'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped cilantro'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'limes, divided'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt, divided'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'raw shrimp, peeled and deveined'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'avocado, diced (Optional)'}
steps: Combine cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, serrano peppers, and cilantro in a bowl. Add 1 teaspoon salt and squeeze 1 lime. Gently mix and set aside.. Squeeze the remaining limes into another bowl. Add remaining salt and pepper.. Bring a 1- to 2-quart pot of water to a boil. Place shrimp into the boiling water for 45 seconds. Quickly remove from the water using a strainer.. Chop the partially cooked shrimp into small pieces and add to the bowl with the seasoned lime mixture. Let sit for 20 minutes. Combine with the cucumber mixture and top with avocados.

name: Tilapia Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tilapia fillets'}, {'quantity': '15', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomato, finely diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'red onion, finely diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumbers, peeled, seeded, and finely diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'finely chopped cilantro'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}
steps: Chop the raw tilapia into small pieces, and place in a large bowl. Pour in enough lime juice to cover the fish.. Mix the tomato, red onion, and cucumbers into the bowl. Stir in the cilantro. Season with salt and pepper.. Allow the ceviche to marinate, refrigerated, for at least an hour. Taste for seasoning before serving; add salt and pepper if necessary.

name: Mexican Mango and White Fish Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'white fish, cut into small cubes'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'orange, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green chile pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'mangoes, cut into cubes'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomatoes, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Combine white fish, lime juice, orange juice, olive oil, and chile pepper in a glass or ceramic bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 90 minutes.. Mix in mangoes and green onions; cover and chill in the refrigerator for 10 minutes more.. Gently fold in tomatoes and cilantro. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

name: Tuna Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'sushi-grade tuna, diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced avocado'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced mango'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'minced red onion'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'minced cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced jalapeno pepper'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Combine tuna, avocado, mango, red onion, cilantro, and jalapeno in a bowl. Drizzle with lime juice and oil and season with salt and pepper. Gently toss to coat evenly. Refrigerate for 1 hour, gently tossing halfway through.

name: Juicy and Spicy Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'cooked seafood mix (such as octopus, squid, shrimp, and surimi)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': "hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®)"}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'cilantro, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocado - peeled, pitted and diced'}
steps: Stir seafood mix and lime juice together in a large, non-metallic bowl; let stand 10 minutes. Fold in diced tomatoes and onion; cover, and refrigerate 30 minutes. Whisk together Worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, tomato paste, cayenne pepper, cumin, chili powder, and salt in a small bowl. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.. After 30 minutes, gently stir 1/2 of the tomato paste mixture into seafood mixture. Cover remaining tomato paste mixture and seafood mixture. Return both to the refrigerator for 30 minutes.. After another 30 minutes, gently stir the remaining tomato paste mixture into ceviche, cover, and refrigerate another 30 minutes.. Gently stir cilantro and diced avocado into ceviche before serving.

name: Fresh Tuna Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'sashimi grade tuna'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'green onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, finely diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lemon juice, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'soy sauce, or to taste'}
steps: Cut tuna into 1/2 inch cubes, and place into a bowl. Stir in the onion, green onions, ginger, jalapeno, lemon juice, and soy sauce; mix to combine. Cover and refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours. Taste before serving and add more lemon juice or soy sauce as needed.

name: Seafood Medley Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'scallops, cut into small chunks'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'shrimp, cut into small chunks'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'tilapia, cut into small chunks'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'lemons, juiced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'orange, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'serrano pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'avocado, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'tomato, seeded and diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'cucumber, peeled and diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato and clam juice cocktail'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon-pepper seasoning'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground white pepper'}
steps: Combine scallops, shrimp, tilapia, lemon juice, lime juice, orange juice, and serrano pepper in a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour, stirring every so often.. Combine avocado, tomato, cucumber, red onion, cilantro, and garlic in a medium bowl.. Whisk tomato and clam juice, vinegar, salt, lemon-pepper seasoning, Worcestershire sauce, and white pepper together in a small bowl. Pour over avocado mixture and stir to combine.. Drain some of the citrus juices off the seafood mixture. Add avocado-tomato juice mixture and stir to combine. Refrigerate for 20 more minutes before serving.

name: Seviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'Spanish onions, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'ripe tomato'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '(8 ounce) cans', 'name': 'oysters, rinsed and drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'ripe tomato, diced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '⅜', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'granulated sugar'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}
steps: Add sliced onions to a saucepan over medium heat and add just enough water to cover. Bring to a simmer and cook just enough to soften. Remove from heat and drain. Rinse with cold water and drain.. Score tomato with an X, skin deep, on the top and bottom. Place in the same saucepan used for the onions and add enough water to cover. Bring to a simmer and cook until soft and the skin starts to peel, about 5 minutes. Remove tomato and rinse under cold water until cool enough to hold in your hand. Using your fingers or the blade of a knife, gently peel off the skin. Place peeled tomato in a blender and purée.. Combine onions, lemon juice, and olive oil in a large glass dish or bowl. Stir in oysters, puréed tomato, diced tomato, green onions, ketchup, and soy sauce. Season with parsley, garlic salt, sugar, and salt to taste.. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes if using canned oysters. Increase marinating time to at least 2 hours in the refrigerator if using raw shrimp, scallops, or fish, until they are opaque in the middle.

name: Javi's Really Real Mexican Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'shrimp'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'scallops'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'lemon, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'white onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, peeled and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomato, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'jalapeño pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'serrano pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: In a large glass or ceramic bowl, gently toss shrimp and scallops with lime juice and lemon juice. Mix in onion, cucumber, tomato, jalapeño, serrano, cilantro, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Cover the bowl and chill in the refrigerator until shrimp and scallops are opaque, about 1 hour.

name: City Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'sea scallops'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'shrimp, peeled and deveined'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'fresh orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'grated orange zest'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'halved, thinly sliced red onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'finely chopped red bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'finely chopped yellow bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced seeded tomato'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'serrano chile pepper, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coarsely chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cayenne pepper (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'avocado, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}
steps: Remove tough side muscles from scallops, if necessary. Slice scallops in half horizontally.. Fill a 1-quart saucepan 3/4 full with salted water and bring to a boil. Add scallops and reduce heat to a low simmer. Poach scallops until just cooked through, about 1 minute. Use a slotted spoon to transfer scallops to a bowl of ice water to stop cooking.. Return water to a boil. Poach shrimp until opaque and pink, 2 to 3 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to transfer shrimp to the same bowl of ice water to stop cooking.. Drain scallops and shrimp. Pat dry with paper towels. Transfer to a glass, ceramic, or other non-reactive bowl. Add lime and orange juice. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.. Pour off juice from seafood, leaving it just moist. Add orange zest, red onion, bell peppers, tomato, chile pepper, cilantro, salt, cumin, and cayenne pepper. Refrigerate an additional 30 minutes.. Just before serving, gently fold in avocado and drizzle ceviche with oil. Serve in martini glasses or stemmed margarita glasses.

name: Clamato Shrimp "Ceviche" Style
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'cooked shrimp'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'fresh jalapeño chile, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, peeled, seeded, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'cilantro, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Clamato Tomato Cocktail'}
steps: In a bowl, combine shrimp, onion, jalapeño, cucumber, and cilantro.. Add lime juice and Clamato; toss to mix well.. Chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.. Serve cold with tostadas (hard tortillas) or soda crackers.

name: 11 Fish Ceviche Recipes for Easy, No-Cook Appetizers
Shrimp and Pineapple Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped cooked shrimp meat'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped red bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh pineapple'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'avocado, peeled, pitted, and chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'cilantro, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'serrano chile pepper, minced, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Toss shrimp, bell pepper, pineapple, avocado, onion, cilantro, lime juice, serrano, garlic, salt, and black pepper together in a glass or ceramic mixing bowl until thoroughly combined. Cover bowl. Refrigerate 1 hour before serving.

name: Sinaloa-Style Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'raw shrimp - peeled, deveined, and cut into small pieces'}, {'quantity': '14', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes, juiced, divided'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'white onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'serrano chile pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'imitation crabmeat, shredded'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomatoes, seeded and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, seeded and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': None, 'name': 'jalapeño peppers, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'cilantro, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato and clam juice cocktail (such as Clamato)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Combine shrimp, juice of 7 limes, and white onion in a large bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until shrimp is opaque, about 12 hours. Drain, discarding accumulated juices.. Blend juice of remaining 7 limes with serrano; transfer to a large bowl.. Add shrimp mixture, crabmeat, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, jalapeños, and cilantro to the bowl. Stir in tomato and clam juice cocktail; season with salt and black pepper.

name: Ceviche de Soya
ingredients: {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'soy protein (TVP)'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'plum tomatoes, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'cucumbers - peeled, seeded, and cubed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'white onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'cilantro leaves, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeno pepper seeded, deveined, and minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': '', 'name': 'crisp-fried tostadas'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocados - peeled, pitted, and cubed'}
steps: Place soy protein in a pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil and boil for 3 minutes. Drain and rinse very well with clean water. Allow to cool completely, about 30 minutes.. Place hydrated soy in a glass bowl and pour lime juice over it. Let stand for 30 minutes. Drain lime juice. Mix in tomatoes, cucumbers, onion, cilantro, and jalapeno. Season with oregano and salt. Serve over tostadas and garnish with avocado.

name: Shrimp Ceviche Baja Style
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'shrimp, deveined and chopped'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped white onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pickled jalapeno peppers and juice, divided'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'grated carrots'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped cucumber'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped celery'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomatoes, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped cilantro'}
steps: Place shrimp in a single layer in a deep serving dish. Add a generous amount of salt and black pepper. Add lime juice and let sit until shrimp become white, about 30 minutes.. Add onion and vinegar from the jalapeno peppers. Let sit 15 to 20 minutes more.. Add jalapeno peppers, carrots, cucumber, celery, tomatoes, and cilantro. Let ceviche sit another 10 minutes.

name: Vegan Hearts of Palm Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '(14.1 ounce) cans', 'name': 'hearts of palm, cut into 3/4-inch slices, juice reserved'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'plum tomatoes - peeled, seeded, and chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'serrano peppers, seeded and minced, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped cilantro leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted green olives'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocado - peeled, pitted, and sliced'}
steps: Place hearts of palm slices in a glass bowl. Add tomatoes, onion, cilantro, and serrano peppers.. Measure 3/4 cup hearts of palm juice into a bowl; discard remaining juice. Mix vinegar and olive oil into the bowl. Pour over hearts of palm mixture. Season with oregano, salt, and pepper. Garnish with olives and avocado slices.

name: Halibut-Mango Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'skinless, boneless halibut, cut into 1/2 inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tequila'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeno chile peppers, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'mango - peeled, seeded and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, seeded and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped Vidalia or other sweet onion'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped red onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'mango - peeled, seeded and diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt, or to taste'}
steps: Combine cubed halibut, lime juice, lemon juice, tequila, minced jalapeno peppers, and 1 diced mango in a non-metallic bowl. Cover and refrigerate for 1 1/2 hours.. After the ceviche has sat for 1 1/2 hours, add the green pepper, sweet onion, and red onion. Mix well, then recover and refrigerate another 30 minutes.. Fold in the remaining diced mango, cilantro, and parsley; season to taste with salt before serving.

name: Scallop Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'fresh scallops, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'clementines - peeled, segmented, and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Roma tomato, diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'scallions, sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemon, juiced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lime, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped cilantro, or to taste (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'sea salt to taste'}
steps: Combine scallops, clementines, tomato, red onion, scallions, lemon juice, lime juice, garlic, cilantro, and olive oil in a large bowl. Season with salt. Refrigerate until flavors combine, stirring occasionally, about 2 hours.

name: Citrus Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'fresh sea bass fillets, sliced 1/4 inch thick'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocados - peeled, pitted, and cubed'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'hard-cooked eggs, quartered'}
steps: In a medium non-reactive bowl combine the lemon juice, lime juice, ginger and olive oil. Add the bass and toss to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for about 2 hours. The flesh of the fish should be white and opaque.. Add the cilantro, onion and avocado. Season to taste with salt and pepper, toss and serve with hard cooked egg wedges.

name: Poor Man's Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'imitation crabmeat, flaked'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Roma (plum) tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'serrano chile peppers, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lime juice, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Mix imitation crabmeat, tomatoes, cilantro, serrano chiles, and green onion together in a large bowl. Pour lime juice over the crabmeat mixture and gently mix; season with salt and pepper.

name: Vegan Jicama Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'jicama, peeled and grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'plum tomatoes, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'white onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tostada shells'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocados - peeled, pitted, and mashed'}
steps: Combine jicama and lime juice in a large glass bowl and let stand for 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes to make sure that all jicama pieces are coated with lime juice. Drain some of the lime juice, depending on your taste.. Mix olive oil and ketchup into the jicama. Stir in tomatoes, onion, and cilantro. Season with oregano, salt, and pepper.. Serve ceviche on tostadas and garnish with avocado.

name: Scallop Ceviche (Kinilaw na Scallops)
ingredients: {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'sea scallops, rinsed and sliced in half horizontally'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'spiced coconut vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'coarsely chopped garlic (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'Roma tomatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped red onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Thai chile pepper, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'calamansi juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'bias-sliced green parts of green onions'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fleur de sel to taste'}
steps: Mix scallops with spiced coconut vinegar in a large bowl. Cover and chill 15 minutes or to desired firmness. Drain immediately, reserving vinegar, and arrange on small plates or in quartered coconut shells.. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add garlic; cook and stir until golden brown and lightly crispy, 3 to 5 minutes.. Mix tomatoes, red onion, ginger, Thai chile, and calamansi with reserved vinegar. Top scallops with tomato mixture and sprinkle with green onions and fried garlic. Finish with a sprinkle of lemon zest and fleur de sel.

name: Bloody Mary Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'cooked, peeled, and deveined shrimp'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'cilantro, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'bottled Bloody Mary mix'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'hot pepper sauce to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and black pepper to taste'}
steps: Lightly mix the shrimp, tomatoes, red onion, cucumber, and cilantro in a bowl, and pour in the Bloody Mary mix. Squeeze the limes over the mixture, add a dash of hot pepper sauce, and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss again, cover the bowl, and refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours, stirring occasionally.

name: Carrot Ceviche (Vegan)
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'carrots, peeled and grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomato, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'serrano pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '15', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh cilantro, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'oranges, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'lime, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Mexican-style hot sauce (such as Cholula®)'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tostada shells'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocado - pitted, peeled, and cubed'}
steps: Mix carrots, tomato, onion, serrano pepper, and cilantro together in a bowl.. Combine ketchup, orange juice, lime juice, and hot sauce in a separate bowl. Pour over vegetables and season with salt. Let stand for 1 hour until flavors are well combined. Drain.. Serve on tostadas and garnish with avocado.

name: Shiitake Mushroom Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh shiitake mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomato, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '9', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pitted green olives, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'orange, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lime, juiced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Mexican-style hot sauce (such as Cholula®), or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}
steps: Bring a pot of salted water to boil. Add shiitake mushrooms and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat, drain, and rinse with cold water. Allow to cool for 10 minutes.. Chop mushrooms as if they were fish for ceviche and place them in a glass bowl. Add tomato, onion, olives, and dried oregano.. Mix orange juice, lime juice, ketchup, Mexican hot sauce, and vinegar in a separate bowl; pour over the mushrooms. Add salt and mix carefully. Refrigerate for 20 minutes to allow flavors to combine.

name: Vegan Mushroom Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '(8 ounce) packages', 'name': 'fresh white mushrooms, chopped'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrots, grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'white onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh serrano pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pickled jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'pickled jalapeno pepper juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocados - peeled, pitted, and sliced'}
steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 10 seconds. Stir in mushrooms and season with salt; cook until soft, about 8 minutes. Remove from heat.. Place mushrooms in a large bowl and add tomatoes, carrots, onion, cilantro, serrano pepper, and jalapeno pepper.. Combine lime juice, tomato juice, ketchup, and pickle juice in a second bowl. Pour over mushroom mixture and let stand for 20 minutes. Serve garnished with avocado slices.

name: Mango Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'mangos - peeled, seeded, and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeno peppers, minced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh cilantro, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes, juiced (with pulp)'}
steps: Mix mangos, onion, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, jalapeno peppers, cilantro, and lime juice together in a bowl.. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until the ceviche is completely chilled, at least 1 hour.

name: Ceviche Self-Portrait
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'shrimp, peeled and deveined'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'roma tomatoes, seeded and diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow onion, finely diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, peeled, seeded, and diced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'serrano peppers, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tostada shells'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'hot pepper sauce'}
steps: Dice shrimp and place in a mixing bowl. Squeeze lime juice over shrimp until they are completely covered, about 4 limes. Stir in the tomatoes, onion, cucumber, serrano peppers, and salt and pepper. Cover, and refrigerate 1 hour.. When ready to serve, adjust seasoning with salt and pepper as needed. Serve on top of tostada shells with a splash of hot sauce, if desired.

name: Easy Cauliflower Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large head', 'name': 'cauliflower'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'carrots, peeled and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'plum tomatoes, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'white onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'cilantro, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocado - peeled, pitted, and sliced'}
steps: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer. Bring water to a boil. Add cauliflower, cover, and steam for 7 minutes. Let cool and finely chop.. Place chopped cauliflower, carrots, tomatoes, onion, and cilantro in a bowl. Pour lime juice on top and season with salt. Cover and chill for at least 30 minutes. Serve garnished with avocado slices.

name: Langostino Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'orange'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'limes, divided'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'lemons'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced red onion'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'kosher salt, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, peeled and slightly crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'serrano chile peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'sea salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried, crushed Mexican oregano'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cayenne pepper, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(12 ounce) packages', 'name': "frozen pre-cooked langostinos (such as Trader Joe's®), thawed"}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'good-quality extra-virgin olive oil'}
steps: Grate 1 teaspoon orange zest into a bowl. Grate 1 teaspoon lime zest into the same bowl. Juice the orange, 4 limes, and both lemons into the same bowl; set aside.. Place red onion in a non-reactive bowl. Add 1/4 cup kosher salt and cover with warm water. Juice the remaining lime into the bowl. Let sit for 10 minutes. Drain and rinse well with cold water; drain again.. Return onion to the non-reactive bowl. Add citrus juice and zest, cilantro sprigs, garlic cloves, serrano peppers, sea salt, oregano, and cayenne. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator, stirring occasionally, for 45 minutes.. Remove from the refrigerator. Remove and discard garlic, serrano peppers, and cilantro sprigs. Add langostino tails and mix gently to combine with the juices. Cover and refrigerate for 45 more minutes.. Remove from the refrigerator and add cherry tomatoes, chopped cilantro, and olive oil; mix well until thoroughly incorporated.. Taste and season with additional kosher salt if needed.

name: Basic Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'halibut, cut into bite-sized pieces'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomato, seeded and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh cilantro, chopped'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced green bell pepper (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'jalapeño pepper, chopped, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper, to taste'}
steps: Place fish into a flat dish; cover with lime juice. Chill fish in refrigerator until tender and opaque, at least 3 hours. Drain lime juice.. Mix tomato, cilantro, green bell pepper, green onion, jalapeño pepper, garlic, salt, and pepper in a bowl; add fish and stir. Chill in refrigerator until flavors blend, about 1 hour.

name: Quick Mushroom Ceviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '(4 ounce) jars', 'name': 'sliced mushrooms, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'white onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped cilantro leaves'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocados - peeled, pitted, and chopped'}
steps: Combine mushrooms, onion, and cilantro in a glass bowl. Add ketchup and lime juice; mix well. Season with salt. Chill for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped avocado before serving.

name: Eric and Debi's Seafood Seviche
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'halibut fillets, cut into 1/4 inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'peeled and deveined shrimp, cut into small pieces'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'sea scallops, cut into small pieces'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh grapefruit juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow bell pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'jalapeno peppers, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced Maui onion'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green olives'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomato, diced'}
steps: Stir the halibut, shrimp, scallops, lemon juice, and grapefruit juice together in a glass bowl. Cover, and refrigerate at least 6 hours until the halibut turns opaque.. Stir the bell pepper, jalapeno pepper, onion, olives, ginger, sugar, salt, and tomato paste together in a glass bowl until no chunks of tomato paste remain. Drain the seafood, and add to the vegetable mixture along with the tomatoes. Gently stir until evenly combined, then return to the refrigerator to chill at least 15 minutes before serving.
